intro: Sisymbrium brasiliense, commonly known as the Brazilian mustards, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium brasiliense is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in a variety of soil types.
